title: Deserialization of Untrusted Data in www/delivery/dxmlrpc.php
content:
An attacker could send a specifically crafted payload to the XML-RPC invocation script and trigger the unserialize() call on the first parameter in the "pluginExecute" RPC method.
Impact
Such vulnerability could be used to perform various types of attacks, e.g. exploit serialize-related PHP vulnerabilities or PHP object injection.
steps: Identify the XML-RPC endpoint at www/delivery/dxmlrpc.php
Craft a malicious payload targeting the 'pluginExecute' RPC method to exploit the unserialize() call
vuln_description: An attacker can send a specially crafted payload to the XML-RPC invocation script, triggering the unserialize() call on the first parameter in the 'pluginExecute' RPC method. This can lead to PHP object injection or other serialize-related vulnerabilities.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding the XML-RPC protocol and crafting a payload to exploit the unserialize() function, which is a known attack vector in PHP. However, the attack does not require complex interactions or multiple components.
